info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 17 at 9:20PM CDT until May 17 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN KIOWA...HARMON...GREER AND NORTHWESTERN HARDEMAN COUNTIES... At 919 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northwest of Martha, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mangum, Hollis, Granite, Blair, Olustee, Lone Wolf, Martha, Willow, Gould, Vinson, Duke, Madge, Brinkman, Hester, McQueen, McKnight and Altus-Lugert Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with this storm may occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
